content: Leverage **AI and Cursor agents** to maintain compliance, security, and developer velocity.

sections.title: Capabilities
content: - Check coding standards and suggest refactors.
- Auto-link commits → PRDs → tasks for traceability.

rules.title: Purpose
rules.content:
## Purpose
Leverage **AI and Cursor agents** to maintain compliance, security, and developer velocity.

rules.title: Capabilities
rules.content:
## Capabilities
- **Automated PR Reviews**:
  - Check coding standards and suggest refactors.
  - Detect anti-patterns and risky changes.
- **Smart Testing**:
  - Generate missing unit/integration tests.
  - Suggest regression or mutation tests.
- **Knowledge Capture**:
  - Auto-link commits → PRDs → tasks for traceability.

rules.title: Pipeline Integration
rules.content:
## Pipeline Integration
1. Cursor Agent scans PR for **Always** and **Auto** rules.
2. Annotates PR with **compliance score and suggestions**.
3. Auto-generates **docs, changelogs, and architectural notes**.

metadata.title: Development Best Practices (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)
keyInsights: - **Rule:** Capture and apply lessons learned systematically across all development phases.
- **Actions:** Document insights, update standards, and integrate into Cursor AI rules.
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/README.md` for complete framework.

sections.title: 1. Mobile‑First & Responsive Design
content: - **Rule:** Start every feature at ≤400px viewport; enhance progressively to larger breakpoints.
- **Actions:** Optimize for LCP and TTI; intuitive mobile navigation.
- **Cursor Effect:** Generates **responsive React/Tailwind components** by default.

sections.title: 2. Observability by Design
content: - **Rule:** Integrate logging, metrics, and tracing (OpenTelemetry + Micrometer) from the start.
- **Actions:** Define KPIs, dashboards, and alerts early.
- **Cursor Effect:** AI‑generated backends are **pre‑instrumented for monitoring**.

sections.title: 3. DRY, KISS & 12‑Factor Principles
content: - **Rule:** Avoid redundant logic; follow DRY, KISS, SOLID, 12‑Factor App.
- **Actions:** Modular and cloud‑ready microservices by design.

sections.title: 4. Performance & Fail‑Fast
content: - **Rule:** Validate inputs early; fail fast; add caching, async, and retries.
- **Actions:** Implement circuit breakers and fallback logic.

sections.title: 5. DevOps & Agile Embedded
content: - **Rule:** Treat CI/CD, IaC, and environment parity as part of development.
- **Actions:** Maintain Dockerfiles, GitHub Actions, reproducible environments.
- **Cursor Effect:** Generates **CI/CD‑ready microservices** without manual tweaks.

sections.title: 6. Lessons Learned Integration
content: - **Rule:** Capture and apply lessons learned systematically across all development phases.
- **Actions:** Document insights, update standards, and integrate into Cursor AI rules.
- **Cursor Effect:** AI generates **continuously improved code patterns** based on project history.

rules.title: Development Best Practices (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)
rules.content: # Development Best Practices (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)

rules.title: 1. Mobile‑First & Responsive Design
rules.content:
## 1. Mobile‑First & Responsive Design
- **Rule:** Start every feature at ≤400px viewport; enhance progressively to larger breakpoints.
- **Actions:** Optimize for LCP and TTI; intuitive mobile navigation.
- **Cursor Effect:** Generates **responsive React/Tailwind components** by default.

rules.title: 2. Observability by Design
rules.content:
## 2. Observability by Design
- **Rule:** Integrate logging, metrics, and tracing (OpenTelemetry + Micrometer) from the start.
- **Actions:** Define KPIs, dashboards, and alerts early.
- **Cursor Effect:** AI‑generated backends are **pre‑instrumented for monitoring**.

rules.title: 3. DRY, KISS & 12‑Factor Principles
rules.content:
## 3. DRY, KISS & 12‑Factor Principles
- **Rule:** Avoid redundant logic; follow DRY, KISS, SOLID, 12‑Factor App.
- **Actions:** Modular and cloud‑ready microservices by design.
- **Cursor Effect:** Scaffolds **modular, maintainable, cloud‑deployable** code.

rules.title: 4. Performance & Fail‑Fast
rules.content:
## 4. Performance & Fail‑Fast
- **Rule:** Validate inputs early; fail fast; add caching, async, and retries.
- **Actions:** Implement circuit breakers and fallback logic.
- **Cursor Effect:** Outputs **resilient, fault‑tolerant services**.

rules.title: 5. DevOps & Agile Embedded
rules.content:
## 5. DevOps & Agile Embedded
- **Rule:** Treat CI/CD, IaC, and environment parity as part of development.
- **Actions:** Maintain Dockerfiles, GitHub Actions, reproducible environments.
- **Cursor Effect:** Generates **CI/CD‑ready microservices** without manual tweaks.

rules.title: 6. Lessons Learned Integration
rules.content:
## 6. Lessons Learned Integration
- **Rule:** Capture and apply lessons learned systematically across all development phases.
- **Actions:** Document insights, update standards, and integrate into Cursor AI rules.
- **Cursor Effect:** AI generates **continuously improved code patterns** based on project history.
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/README.md` for complete framework.

metadata.title: CI/CD Strategy for Agent-OS Projects
keyInsights: 7. **Lessons Learned Integration**: Capture deployment insights and update CI/CD processes based on lessons learned.
**Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/deployment/README.md` for deployment lessons.

sections.title: Context
content: GitHub Actions-based CI/CD for React (frontend) + Spring Boot (backend) + Dockerized stack (Postgres, InfluxDB, Prometheus, Grafana).

sections.title: Goals
content: - Enforce vulnerability scanning and coverage gates
- Provide optional preview environments for PRs

sections.title: Key Practices
content: 1. **Lint & Format**: ESLint + Prettier for frontend, Checkstyle/Spotless for backend.
2. **Unit & Integration Tests**: Jest + Vitest for React; JUnit + Jacoco for Spring Boot.
4. **Docker Build**: Multi-stage builds for frontend & backend with minimal base images.
- Dependency scans: OWASP Dep-Check, npm audit, Snyk
6. **Deploy Previews**: Use ephemeral environments (e.g., Uffizzi) to review PRs.
7. **Lessons Learned Integration**: Capture deployment insights and update CI/CD processes based on lessons learned.

rules.title: Context
rules.content:
## Context
GitHub Actions-based CI/CD for React (frontend) + Spring Boot (backend) + Dockerized stack (Postgres, InfluxDB, Prometheus, Grafana).

rules.title: Goals
rules.content:
### Goals
- Automate linting, testing, coverage enforcement
- Build and scan Docker images
- Enforce vulnerability scanning and coverage gates
- Provide optional preview environments for PRs

rules.title: Key Practices
rules.content:
### Key Practices
1. **Lint & Format**: ESLint + Prettier for frontend, Checkstyle/Spotless for backend.
2. **Unit & Integration Tests**: Jest + Vitest for React; JUnit + Jacoco for Spring Boot.
3. **Coverage Gate**: Fail build if <85% coverage.
4. **Docker Build**: Multi-stage builds for frontend & backend with minimal base images.
5. **Security Scans**:
   - Dependency scans: OWASP Dep-Check, npm audit, Snyk
   - Container scans: Trivy
   - Optional SAST: CodeQL
6. **Deploy Previews**: Use ephemeral environments (e.g., Uffizzi) to review PRs.
7. **Lessons Learned Integration**: Capture deployment insights and update CI/CD processes based on lessons learned.

See `ci-example-workflow.yml` for implementation example.
**Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/deployment/README.md` for deployment lessons.

metadata.title: Code Style Guide (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)
keyInsights: - **Capture:** Document code style insights and patterns that improve maintainability
- **Apply:** Update style guides based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/development/README.md` for development lessons

sections.title: General Formatting
content: - Use Prettier and ESLint for JS/TS; Spotless and Checkstyle for Java.
- Auto-format on save; enforce style in CI.

sections.title: Naming Conventions
content: - **Java:** packages lowercase, Classes PascalCase, methods camelCase, constants UPPER_SNAKE_CASE.

sections.title: Import & Structure
content: - Avoid Java wildcard imports; order: external → internal; remove unused automatically.
- **Spring Boot:** package by feature; root @SpringBootApplication class.
- **React:** functional components with hooks; co-locate component, test, style files.

sections.title: Code Style Lessons Learned
content: - **Capture:** Document code style insights and patterns that improve maintainability
- **Apply:** Update style guides based on lessons learned
**Cursor Effect:** Ensures **all AI-generated code matches style automatically**, reducing review cycles.

rules.title: Code Style Guide (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)
rules.content: # Code Style Guide (Enhanced for Cursor/Agent-OS)

rules.title: General Formatting
rules.content:
## General Formatting
- Use Prettier and ESLint for JS/TS; Spotless and Checkstyle for Java.
- Auto-format on save; enforce style in CI.

rules.title: Naming Conventions
rules.content:
## Naming Conventions
- **Java:** packages lowercase, Classes PascalCase, methods camelCase, constants UPPER_SNAKE_CASE.
- **TypeScript/JS:** variables/functions camelCase, React components PascalCase.

rules.title: Import & Structure
rules.content:
## Import & Structure
- Avoid Java wildcard imports; order: external → internal; remove unused automatically.
- **Spring Boot:** package by feature; root @SpringBootApplication class.
- **React:** functional components with hooks; co-locate component, test, style files.

rules.title: Code Style Lessons Learned
rules.content:
## Code Style Lessons Learned
- **Capture:** Document code style insights and patterns that improve maintainability
- **Apply:** Update style guides based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/development/README.md` for development lessons

**Cursor Effect:** Ensures **all AI-generated code matches style automatically**, reducing review cycles.

metadata.title: Cursor Rule Hierarchy
recommendations: - Default recommendations by Cursor AI; can be bypassed with approval.

sections.title: Purpose
content: A tiered system for classifying enforcement levels across all Cursor rules, allowing scalable governance without stifling innovation.

sections.title: Tiers
content: - Non-negotiable; applied to all branches and environments.
- Examples: Security hardening, SBOM generation, forbidden imports.
- Default recommendations by Cursor AI; can be bypassed with approval.
- Examples: Performance suggestions, lint autofixes, refactoring hints.
- Examples: PRD generation, doc auto-linking, AI-based test generation.

sections.title: Key Practices
content: - Store rules in `.cursor/rules` with MDC format.
- Integrate into **CI/CD**: fail PR on Always violations; warn on Auto; annotate on Agent.

rules.title: Purpose
rules.content:
## Purpose
A tiered system for classifying enforcement levels across all Cursor rules, allowing scalable governance without stifling innovation.

rules.title: Tiers
rules.content:
### Tiers
1. **Always**
   - Non-negotiable; applied to all branches and environments.
   - Examples: Security hardening, SBOM generation, forbidden imports.
2. **Auto**
   - Default recommendations by Cursor AI; can be bypassed with approval.
   - Examples: Performance suggestions, lint autofixes, refactoring hints.
3. **Agent**
   - AI-assisted optimizations or project enhancements.
   - Examples: PRD generation, doc auto-linking, AI-based test generation.

rules.title: Key Practices
rules.content:
### Key Practices
- Store rules in `.cursor/rules` with MDC format.
- Attach **policy tags** like `SECURITY`, `QUALITY`, `OBSERVABILITY`.
- Integrate into **CI/CD**: fail PR on Always violations; warn on Auto; annotate on Agent.

sections.title: Context
content: Full-stack Agent‑OS project with React frontend, Spring Boot backend, and observability stack.

sections.title: Notes
content: - Supports targeted Cursor rules for frontend, backend, infra
- Works seamlessly with CI/CD and Agent‑OS

rules.title: Context
rules.content:
## Context
Full-stack Agent‑OS project with React frontend, Spring Boot backend, and observability stack.

```
my-project/
├── frontend/                 # React app
│   ├── package.json
│   ├── src/
│   └── Dockerfile
├── backend/                  # Spring Boot app
│   ├── pom.xml (or build.gradle)
│   ├── src/main/java/com/example/...
│   ├── src/main/resources/
│   └── Dockerfile
├── infrastructure/           # Infrastructure & observability
│   ├── docker-compose.yml
│   ├── prometheus/prometheus.yml
│   └── grafana/dashboards/
├── .github/workflows/        # CI/CD workflows
└── .cursor/rules/            # Cursor AI rule files (*.mdc)
```

rules.title: Notes
rules.content:
### Notes
- Separate concerns for maintainability
- Supports targeted Cursor rules for frontend, backend, infra
- Works seamlessly with CI/CD and Agent‑OS

rules.title: Backend (Java/Spring Boot)
rules.content:
### Backend (Java/Spring Boot)
**ALWAYS** use:
- Spring Boot 3.3+ (Java 21 LTS)
- Spring Security with OAuth 2.1
- JPA/Hibernate with PostgreSQL 17
- Spring Boot Actuator for monitoring
- SLF4J for logging
- @Async for background processing
- Controller → Service → Repository pattern

rules.title: Frontend (React/TypeScript)
rules.content:
### Frontend (React/TypeScript)
**ALWAYS** use:
- React 19 stable with TypeScript 5
- Functional components with hooks
- TanStack Query 5 for data fetching
- Context API for lightweight state
- TailwindCSS 4.x + shadcn/ui
- Vitest + jsdom for unit tests
- Cypress for e2e tests

rules.title: Database
rules.content:
### Database
**ALWAYS** use:
- PostgreSQL 17 with pgvector extension
- InfluxDB 3 Core for time-series data
- JPA/Hibernate for ORM
- Connection pooling
- Proper indexing strategies

rules.title: AI/ML
rules.content:
### AI/ML
**ALWAYS** use:
- OpenAI GPT-4o for NLP
- pgvector for vector embeddings
- LangChain 0.2 for AI applications
- Async/await patterns for API calls

rules.title: Infrastructure
rules.content:
### Infrastructure
**ALWAYS** use:
- Docker 24 with Compose V2
- GitHub Actions for CI/CD
- Prometheus v2.50 + Grafana 11
- Loki 3 for logging
- Multi-stage Docker builds

rules.title: Java/Spring Boot
TypeScript/React
CSS/TailwindCSS
Layered Architecture
rules.content:
### Layered Architecture
```
Controller Layer (REST API)
    ↓
Service Layer (Business Logic)
    ↓
Repository Layer (Data Access)
    ↓
Database Layer (PostgreSQL/InfluxDB)
```

rules.title: Security Patterns
Error Handling
Unit Tests (Java)
Unit Tests (TypeScript)
Backend Performance
rules.content:
### Backend Performance
- P95 response time ≤ 200ms
- Use connection pooling
- Implement proper caching (Redis)
- Use async processing for heavy operations
- Monitor with Spring Boot Actuator + Prometheus

rules.title: Frontend Performance
rules.content:
### Frontend Performance
- Time to Interactive (TTI) ≤ 2s on LTE
- Use code splitting with React.lazy()
- Implement proper loading states
- Use TanStack Query for caching
- Monitor with @vercel/analytics

rules.title: Authentication & Authorization
rules.content:
### Authentication & Authorization
- Use Spring Security with OAuth 2.1
- Implement JWT token validation
- Use role-based access control (RBAC)
- Validate all inputs
- Use HTTPS/TLS 1.3

rules.title: Data Protection
rules.content:
### Data Protection
- Encrypt sensitive data at rest
- Use parameterized queries (JPA)
- Implement proper session management
- Follow OWASP Top-10 guidelines
- Use Helmet.js for security headers

rules.title: Metrics
Logging
Tracing
Validation Checklist
rules.content:
## Validation Checklist

Before generating any code, verify:

rules.title: Technology Stack
rules.content:
### Technology Stack
- [ ] Spring Boot 3.3+ (Java 21 LTS) for backend
- [ ] React 19 with TypeScript 5 for frontend
- [ ] PostgreSQL 17 with pgvector for database
- [ ] InfluxDB 3 Core for time-series data
- [ ] OpenAI GPT-4o for AI capabilities
- [ ] Docker 24 for containerization

rules.title: Code Style
rules.content:
### Code Style
- [ ] 2 spaces indentation
- [ ] 100 chars soft max line length
- [ ] PascalCase for components/classes
- [ ] camelCase for variables/functions
- [ ] Functional components with hooks
- [ ] Proper TypeScript types

rules.title: Architecture
rules.content:
### Architecture
- [ ] Controller → Service → Repository pattern
- [ ] Clear separation of concerns
- [ ] Proper exception handling
- [ ] Security implementation
- [ ] Observability setup

rules.title: Testing
rules.content:
### Testing
- [ ] Unit tests with ≥80% branch coverage
- [ ] Integration tests for critical paths
- [ ] E2E tests with Cypress
- [ ] Static analysis tools

rules.title: Performance
rules.content:
### Performance
- [ ] Backend P95 ≤ 200ms
- [ ] Frontend TTI ≤ 2s on LTE
- [ ] Proper caching implementation
- [ ] Database optimization

rules.title: Security
rules.content:
### Security
- [ ] Input validation
- [ ] Authentication/Authorization
- [ ] HTTPS/TLS implementation
- [ ] OWASP Top-10 compliance

rules.title: Strict Compliance
rules.content:
### Strict Compliance
- **NEVER** deviate from these standards without explicit approval
- **ALWAYS** reference this document when making technology decisions
- **ALWAYS** follow the established patterns and conventions
- **ALWAYS** use the specified versions and configurations

rules.title: Code Review Requirements
rules.content:
### Code Review Requirements
- All code must pass static analysis
- All code must meet test coverage requirements
- All code must follow security guidelines
- All code must meet performance standards

rules.title: Documentation Requirements
rules.content:
### Documentation Requirements
- All public APIs must have JavaDoc/TSDoc
- All configuration must be documented
- All deployment procedures must be documented
- All operational procedures must be documented

rules.content:
## References

- Technology Stack: `@~/.agent-os/standards/tech-stack.md`
- Code Style: `@~/.agent-os/standards/code-style.md`
- Best Practices: `@~/.agent-os/standards/best-practices.md`
- JavaScript Style: `@~/.agent-os/standards/code-style/javascript-style.md`

- Lessons Learned Framework: `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/README.md`

rules.title: Mandatory Lessons Learned Protocol
rules.content:
### Mandatory Lessons Learned Protocol

**ALWAYS** capture lessons learned after completing any significant development task or milestone.

**MANDATORY**: Every task list must include a lessons learned sub-task as the final sub-task of each main task.

rules.title: 1. Capture Triggers
rules.content:
#### 1. Capture Triggers
- **ALWAYS** capture lessons after sub-task completion
- **ALWAYS** capture lessons after milestone completion
- **ALWAYS** capture lessons after incident resolution
- **ALWAYS** capture lessons after performance optimizations
- **ALWAYS** capture lessons after security implementations
- **MANDATORY**: Include lessons learned sub-task in every task list

rules.title: Lesson Capture Process
rules.content:
# Lesson Capture Process
1. Use appropriate category directory
2. Follow lesson template structure
3. Include all required sections
4. Add appropriate tags for searching
5. Link to related lessons and standards
```

rules.title: 3. Integration Process
rules.content:
#### 3. Integration Process
- **ALWAYS** review lessons weekly during active development
- **ALWAYS** integrate high-impact lessons into standards
- **ALWAYS** update Cursor rules with new patterns
- **ALWAYS** communicate changes to all teams
- **ALWAYS** monitor adoption and effectiveness

rules.title: 4. Validation Checklist for Lessons Learned
rules.content:
#### 4. Validation Checklist for Lessons Learned
Before completing any development session, verify:
- [ ] Lessons are captured for significant tasks
- [ ] Lessons follow template structure
- [ ] Lessons include actionable recommendations
- [ ] Lessons are properly categorized and tagged
- [ ] High-impact lessons are identified for integration
- [ ] Every task list includes lessons learned sub-tasks
- [ ] Lessons learned sub-tasks are marked complete after task completion

rules.title: Lesson Template
rules.content:
# Lesson Template
- Lesson Information (Date, Project, Phase, Priority)
- Context (What was the situation?)
- Action Taken (What was done?)
- Results (What were the outcomes?)
- Key Insights (What did we learn?)
- Recommendations (What should we do differently?)
- Impact Assessment (How significant is this lesson?)
- Related Lessons (Links to related experiences)
- Follow-up Actions (What needs to be done?)
- Tags (Categories for searching)
```

rules.title: Strict Compliance
rules.content:
#### Strict Compliance
- **NEVER** complete significant development without capturing lessons
- **ALWAYS** use the standard lesson template
- **ALWAYS** include actionable recommendations
- **ALWAYS** categorize lessons appropriately
- **ALWAYS** link to related lessons and standards
- **MANDATORY**: Include lessons learned sub-task in every task list
- **MANDATORY**: Complete lessons learned sub-task after each main task

rules.title: Quality Standards
rules.content:
#### Quality Standards
- **ALWAYS** provide clear context and background
- **ALWAYS** describe specific actions taken
- **ALWAYS** document measurable outcomes
- **ALWAYS** include technical and process insights
- **ALWAYS** provide specific, actionable recommendations

rules.title: Mandatory Task Update Protocol
rules.content:
### Mandatory Task Update Protocol

**ALWAYS** update the corresponding `tasks.md` file immediately after completing any subtask, not at the end of a session.

rules.title: 1. Immediate Updates
rules.content:
#### 1. Immediate Updates
- **ALWAYS** mark completed subtasks with `[x]` immediately after completion
- **ALWAYS** add progress notes for completed sections
- **ALWAYS** update completion percentages
- **NEVER** wait until the end of a session to update tasks

rules.title: 2. Progress Documentation
rules.content:
#### 2. Progress Documentation
```markdown
- [x] 1.1 Write tests for new database entities
  - **Progress Note**: Unit tests implemented with 95% coverage
  - **Completed**: 2025-08-03 19:45
  - **Next**: 1.2 Create database migration script
```

rules.title: ✅ Completed in This Session
rules.content:
### ✅ Completed in This Session
- [x] Task 1.1: Description of what was completed
- [x] Task 2.3: Description of what was completed

rules.title: 🔄 Next Priority Tasks
rules.content:
### 🔄 Next Priority Tasks
- [ ] Task 1.2: Next immediate task
- [ ] Task 2.4: Next immediate task

rules.title: 📊 Progress Update
rules.content:
### 📊 Progress Update
- **Overall Progress**: X% Complete
- **Sections Complete**: X/Y major sections
- **Remaining Work**: Brief description
```

rules.title: 4. Validation Checklist for Task Updates
rules.content:
#### 4. Validation Checklist for Task Updates
Before ending any development session, verify:
- [ ] All completed subtasks are marked with `[x]`
- [ ] Progress notes are added for completed sections
- [ ] Session summary is documented
- [ ] Next priority tasks are clearly identified
- [ ] Overall progress percentage is updated
- [ ] Remaining work is documented

rules.title: Tasks
rules.content:
## Tasks
- [ ] 1. **Major Section Title**
  - [ ] 1.1 Subtask description
  - [ ] 1.2 Subtask description
  - **Progress Note**: Current status and next steps

rules.title: ✅ Completed in Latest Session (YYYY-MM-DD)
rules.content:
### ✅ Completed in Latest Session (YYYY-MM-DD)
- Description of major accomplishments

rules.title: 🔄 Next Priority Tasks
rules.content:
### 🔄 Next Priority Tasks
- List of immediate next steps

rules.title: Overall Progress: X% Complete
rules.content:
## Overall Progress: X% Complete
- **Completed Sections**: List of completed major sections
- **Remaining Work**: Brief description of remaining work
```

rules.title: Strict Compliance
rules.content:
#### Strict Compliance
- **NEVER** complete a subtask without updating the tasks.md file
- **ALWAYS** update tasks immediately after completion
- **ALWAYS** document progress notes for context
- **ALWAYS** maintain accurate completion percentages

rules.title: Quality Standards
rules.content:
#### Quality Standards
- **ALWAYS** use clear, descriptive task names
- **ALWAYS** provide sufficient detail in progress notes
- **ALWAYS** maintain chronological order of updates
- **ALWAYS** cross-reference with related documentation

rules.title: Integration with Development Workflow
rules.content:
#### Integration with Development Workflow
- **ALWAYS** check tasks.md before starting new work
- **ALWAYS** update tasks.md after completing work
- **ALWAYS** reference tasks.md in commit messages
- **ALWAYS** include task updates in pull request descriptions

actionItems: - [ ] Lessons are captured for significant tasks
- [ ] Lessons are properly categorized and tagged
- [ ] High-impact lessons are identified for integration
- [ ] Every task list includes lessons learned sub-tasks
- [ ] Lessons learned sub-tasks are marked complete after task completion
- [ ] All completed subtasks are marked with `[x]`
- [ ] Progress notes are added for completed sections
- [ ] Next priority tasks are clearly identified

sections.title: Purpose
content: Automate enforcement of rules across **code, CI/CD, and infrastructure**.

sections.title: Components
content: - **Cursor Rules**: Code quality, test coverage, style, and AI usage.
- **Report coverage** of enforced vs suggested rules.

sections.title: Best Practice Stack
content: - OPA + Conftest for IaC and K8s.

rules.title: Purpose
rules.content:
## Purpose
Automate enforcement of rules across **code, CI/CD, and infrastructure**.

rules.title: Components
rules.content:
## Components
- **OPA/Rego Policies**: Enforce infrastructure & security standards.
- **Cursor Rules**: Code quality, test coverage, style, and AI usage.
- **CI/CD Integration**:
  - GitHub Actions step for **policy validation**.
  - **Fail builds** on critical policy breaches.
  - **Report coverage** of enforced vs suggested rules.

rules.title: Best Practice Stack
rules.content:
## Best Practice Stack
- OPA + Conftest for IaC and K8s.
- Sigstore & SLSA for **supply-chain security**.
- Cursor hooks for **AI-driven governance**.

metadata.title: Security & Compliance Standard (Enhanced)
keyInsights: - **Apply:** Update security standards based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/operations/README.md` for security lessons

sections.title: Secure Defaults & Hardening
content: - Deny-by-default; TLS and headers enabled by default.
- Run containers as non-root; drop unneeded Linux capabilities.

sections.title: Dependency Management (SCA)
content: - Use OWASP Dep‑Check, Snyk, Dependabot; maintain SBOMs.

sections.title: Container & Infra Security
content: - Minimal base images (alpine/distroless), Trivy scans in CI.
- Scan IaC for misconfigurations (Checkov, AWS Config).

sections.title: Secret Management
content: - No secrets in code; use Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or GitHub Secrets.
- Rotate secrets regularly; enable leak detection.

sections.title: OWASP Top 10 Compliance
content: - Robust authz; parameterized queries; proper crypto.

sections.title: Security Lessons Learned
content: - **Capture:** Document security incidents, vulnerabilities, and mitigation strategies
- **Apply:** Update security standards based on lessons learned
**Cursor Effect:** Avoids insecure code and **generates DevSecOps-ready pipelines and configs**.

rules.title: Secure Defaults & Hardening
rules.content:
## Secure Defaults & Hardening
- Deny-by-default; TLS and headers enabled by default.
- Run containers as non-root; drop unneeded Linux capabilities.

rules.title: Dependency Management (SCA)
rules.content:
## Dependency Management (SCA)
- Use OWASP Dep‑Check, Snyk, Dependabot; maintain SBOMs.

rules.title: Container & Infra Security
rules.content:
## Container & Infra Security
- Minimal base images (alpine/distroless), Trivy scans in CI.
- Scan IaC for misconfigurations (Checkov, AWS Config).

rules.title: Secret Management
rules.content:
## Secret Management
- No secrets in code; use Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or GitHub Secrets.
- Rotate secrets regularly; enable leak detection.

rules.title: OWASP Top 10 Compliance
rules.content:
## OWASP Top 10 Compliance
- Robust authz; parameterized queries; proper crypto.
- Logging & alerting for suspicious activity.

rules.title: Security Lessons Learned
rules.content:
## Security Lessons Learned
- **Capture:** Document security incidents, vulnerabilities, and mitigation strategies
- **Apply:** Update security standards based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/operations/README.md` for security lessons

**Cursor Effect:** Avoids insecure code and **generates DevSecOps-ready pipelines and configs**.

sections.title: Purpose
content: Provide **fine-grained, domain-specific rules** for each service and technology stack.

sections.title: Examples
content: - Pre-render analytics hooks in Agent mode.

rules.title: Purpose
rules.content:
## Purpose
Provide **fine-grained, domain-specific rules** for each service and technology stack.

rules.title: Examples
rules.content:
## Examples
- **Stripe/Payments**:
  - Mandatory **idempotency for POST endpoints**.
  - Enforce **PCI-compliant logging**.
- **Next.js Frontend**:
  - Ensure **ISR and SEO meta tags**.
  - Pre-render analytics hooks in Agent mode.
- **Database/ORM**:
  - Auto-detect **N+1 queries**.
  - Suggest **index creation** via AI.

rules.title: Frontend
rules.content:
## Frontend
- React 18.x + TypeScript 5.x
- TailwindCSS 4.x (modern JIT + performance upgrades)
- Vite or Webpack 5 for builds

rules.title: Backend
rules.content:
## Backend
- Spring Boot 3.5.x (Java 17+)
- Maven or Gradle
- Micrometer + OpenTelemetry for observability

rules.title: Databases & Time Series
rules.content:

- PostgreSQL 15/16 (with pgvector support)
- InfluxDB 2.x (3.x for high-scale scenarios)

rules.title: AI/ML
rules.content:

- OpenAI GPT-4o Mini (primary model for cost-effective operations)
- OpenAI GPT-4o (advanced model for complex reasoning)
- OpenAI GPT-3.5 Turbo (fallback model for simple operations)
- pgvector 0.7 for vector embeddings
- LangChain 0.3 for AI application development

rules.title: Observability

## Observability
- Prometheus 3.x + Grafana 10.x
- Alertmanager for notifications

rules.title: CI/CD & Containers

- Docker 24+ multi-stage builds
- GitHub Actions for CI/CD pipelines

metadata.title: Testing Strategy & Quality Standards (Enhanced)
keyInsights: - **Capture:** Document testing insights, patterns, and failures
- **Apply:** Update test strategies based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/testing/README.md` for testing lessons

sections.title: Testing Trophy Approach
content: - Combine unit, integration, E2E tests, plus static analysis.

sections.title: Tools
content: - **Frontend:** Jest + React Testing Library; Cypress or Playwright for E2E

sections.title: Coverage Targets
content: - Aim ~80% meaningful coverage; CI fails below ~70%

sections.title: AI-Assisted Testing
content: - Use AI to scaffold repetitive tests; review for correctness.

sections.title: CI Integration
content: - Run all tests on each PR; fail fast; track flaky tests.

sections.title: Lessons Learned in Testing
content: - **Capture:** Document testing insights, patterns, and failures
- **Apply:** Update test strategies based on lessons learned
**Cursor Effect:** Can auto‑generate **unit and integration tests** following project coverage & style.

rules.title: Testing Strategy & Quality Standards (Enhanced)
rules.content: # Testing Strategy & Quality Standards (Enhanced)

rules.title: Testing Trophy Approach
rules.content:
## Testing Trophy Approach
- Combine unit, integration, E2E tests, plus static analysis.

rules.title: Tools
rules.content:
## Tools
- **Backend:** JUnit 5, Mockito, Testcontainers, Jacoco
- **Frontend:** Jest + React Testing Library; Cypress or Playwright for E2E

rules.title: Coverage Targets
rules.content:
## Coverage Targets
- Aim ~80% meaningful coverage; CI fails below ~70%

rules.title: AI-Assisted Testing
rules.content:
## AI-Assisted Testing
- Use AI to scaffold repetitive tests; review for correctness.

rules.title: CI Integration
rules.content:
## CI Integration
- Run all tests on each PR; fail fast; track flaky tests.

rules.title: Lessons Learned in Testing
rules.content:
## Lessons Learned in Testing
- **Capture:** Document testing insights, patterns, and failures
- **Apply:** Update test strategies based on lessons learned
- **Reference:** See `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/categories/testing/README.md` for testing lessons

**Cursor Effect:** Can auto‑generate **unit and integration tests** following project coverage & style.

sections.title: Purpose
content: Prevent UI regressions and improve test confidence with **world-class visual testing and mutation analysis**.

sections.title: Components
content: - **Mutation Testing** using **Stryker or PIT** to validate test effectiveness.

sections.title: CI/CD Integration
content: - Annotate non-critical visual changes for **manual review**.

rules.title: Purpose
rules.content:
## Purpose
Prevent UI regressions and improve test confidence with **world-class visual testing and mutation analysis**.

rules.title: Components
rules.content:
## Components
- **Playwright + Percy/Chromatic** for visual diffs.
- **Snapshot Testing** for React components.
- **Mutation Testing** using **Stryker or PIT** to validate test effectiveness.
- **AI Gap Detection**:
  - Identify untested branches or conditions.
  - Suggest automated test generation.

rules.title: CI/CD Integration
rules.content:
## CI/CD Integration
- Fail pipeline on **critical visual diffs**.
- Annotate non-critical visual changes for **manual review**.

patterns.name: Task Structure Template
patterns.content:
### Task Structure Template
Each task should follow this structure:

```markdown
- [ ] [Task Number]. **[Task Title]**
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from [task name] implementation
  - **Progress Note**: [Brief description of current progress]
```

usageExamples:
```markdown
- [ ] [Task Number]. **[Task Title]**
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - [ ] [Task Number].[Sub-task Number] **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from [task name] implementation
  - **Progress Note**: [Brief description of current progress]
```

```markdown
- [ ] [Task Number].[Final Sub-task Number] **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from [task name] implementation
```

```markdown
- [x] [Sub-task Number] [Sub-task description]
  - **Progress Note**: [Detailed description of what was accomplished]
  - **Completed**: [Timestamp]
  - **Next**: [Next sub-task to work on]
```

```markdown
- [ ] 1. **Example Task**
  - [ ] 1.1 Implement core functionality
  - [ ] 1.2 Add error handling
  - [ ] 1.3 Create unit tests
  - [ ] 1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from example task implementation
  - **Progress Note**: Core functionality implementation in progress

- [x] 2. **Completed Task**
  - [x] 2.1 Implement feature A
  - [x] 2.2 Add feature B
  - [x] 2.3 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from completed task implementation
  - **Progress Note**: All features implemented and tested successfully
```

sections.title: Cursor Init Process - Agent OS Framework
content: # Cursor Init Process - Agent OS Framework

sections.title: Overview
content: This document defines the Cursor init process for the .agent-os framework. The process converts .md files into .mdc rules that Cursor can use, ensuring all rules are generated from Markdown documentation.

sections.title: !/usr/bin/env node
content: // Parse Markdown and extract rule-worthy content
// Convert section to Cursor rule format
**Generated by Agent OS Cursor Init Process**

sections.title: .github/workflows/cursor-init.yml
content: - run: git commit -m "Update Cursor rules" || true

sections.title: Implementation Goals
content: - **Rule Generation**: 100% of .md files converted to .mdc rules
- **Validation Success**: 95% of generated rules pass validation

metadata.title: Lessons Learned Framework Improvements - Agent OS
keyInsights: This project enhances the .agent-os lessons learned framework with simple, incremental improvements using existing technology stack. Focus on Cursor AI integration while maintaining the "keep it simple, steady & secure" philosophy.
- [x] 1.1.1 Add automatic rule generation from .md lessons learned using vanilla JavaScript
- [x] 1.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from enhanced Cursor rule generation implementation

- **Progress Note**: ✅ Successfully implemented automatic rule generation from .md lessons learned. Processed 20 lesson files and generated 6 rules. Key insights: metadata extraction needs to be flexible to handle various lesson formats, path resolution is critical for cross-platform compatibility, and template literals in HTML strings need proper escaping.
- [ ] 2.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from Cursor init process implementation

- **Progress Note**: ✅ Successfully implemented Cursor init process. Generated 208 rules from .md files with proper validation and categorization. Key insights: simple glob implementation works well for file discovery, rule type categorization improves organization, and metadata extraction provides valuable context for rule generation.
- [ ] 3.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from Cursor analytics implementation
- [ ] 4.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from Cursor rule optimization implementation
- [ ] 5.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from enhanced lesson capture process implementation
- [ ] 6.1 **Integrate lessons learned with existing analytics**
- [ ] 6.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from analytics integration implementation
- [ ] 7.1 **Improve documentation-analyzer.js for lessons learned**
- [ ] 7.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from enhanced documentation analysis implementation
- [ ] 8.1.4 **Update lessons learned** - Capture insights from lesson validation engine implementation
- Created lessons-learned-improvements.md following .agent-os standards
- ✅ **COMPLETED**: Task 1.1.1 - Automatic rule generation from .md lessons learned
- Key technical insights: flexible metadata extraction, cross-platform path resolution, HTML template literal escaping

sections.title: Mission Alignment
content: This project enhances the .agent-os lessons learned framework with simple, incremental improvements using existing technology stack. Focus on Cursor AI integration while maintaining the "keep it simple, steady & secure" philosophy.

content: - **No external databases** or data science tools

Key insights: metadata extraction needs to be flexible to handle various lesson formats, path resolution is critical for cross-platform compatibility, and template literals in HTML strings need proper escaping.

sections.title: Simple Analytics Enhancements - Agent OS Framework
content: # Simple Analytics Enhancements - Agent OS Framework

sections.title: Project Overview
content: Enhance the Agent OS framework with simple analytics capabilities using the existing technology stack, focusing on incremental improvements without introducing complexity or new technology requirements.

sections.title: Mission Alignment
content: This enhancement aligns with the Agent OS mission to provide intelligent, data-driven development capabilities while maintaining the framework's "keep it simple, steady & secure" philosophy. All improvements use existing technology stack and skills.

sections.title: Technology Constraints
content: - **No external databases** or data science tools

sections.title: Expected Impact:
content: - **Operational Efficiency**: Complete forecasting and success prediction

sections.title: Overall Progress: 99% Complete
content: - **Completed Sections**: Enhanced metrics collection, statistical analysis, documentation analysis, historical data tracking, validation performance tracking, pattern recognition, file processing performance monitoring, recurring issues detection, enhanced HTML dashboard, violation clustering analysis, compliance issue prediction, interactive charts, improvement suggestions, rule-based suggestions, standards effectiveness tracking, enhanced reporting system, actionable insights engine, basic prediction engine, pattern-based suggestions, simple forecasting, risk assessment, confidence scoring, trend visualization, timeline visualization, progress tracking dashboards, trend comparison views, standards reference tracking, standards clarification identification, enhanced trend analysis, predictive analytics, violation timeline analysis, progress tracking, trend comparison, standards analysis, standards effectiveness tracking completion, standards usage tracking completion, documentation quality metrics, smart documentation suggestions, enhanced reporting system completion, actionable insights engine completion, drill-down capabilities, exportable reports, prioritized action items, impact assessment, suggestion validation, real-time monitoring, notification system, basic prediction engine completion, risk assessment capabilities completion, unified analytics interface completion, dashboard usability enhancement completion
- **Remaining Work**: 2 tasks with 8 subtasks (improvement forecasting, success prediction)
- **Timeline**: 1 day remaining for full simple analytics implementation
- **Resource Requirements**: 1 developer with existing Node.js skills

sections.title: Success Metrics
content: - **Analytics Coverage**: 100% of framework components with simple analytics
- **Processing Speed**: <2 second latency for all analytics
- **Prediction Accuracy**: 80%+ accuracy for simple predictive models
- **User Adoption**: 95% team adoption of enhanced features
- **Technology Compliance**: 100% use of existing technology stack

sections.title: Risk Assessment
content: - **Low Priority**: Data storage and file management
- **Low Priority**: Performance optimization for larger datasets
- **Low Priority**: User training for new features

sections.title: Technology Requirements
content: - **No New Dependencies**: Use only existing packages (glob, chokidar)
- **File-Based Storage**: JSON files for data storage
- **Simple Processing**: Statistical analysis using built-in JavaScript
- **HTML Visualization**: Vanilla JavaScript charts and dashboards

sections.title: Implementation Principles
content: - **Simplicity First**: All enhancements must be simple to understand and maintain
- **Existing Technology**: No new technologies or complex frameworks
- **Incremental Improvement**: Build on existing tools and capabilities
- **Framework Alignment**: Maintain "keep it simple, steady & secure" philosophy
- **Resource Efficiency**: Minimize development and maintenance overhead

metadata.title: Agent OS Framework Technology Stack - Agent Improvements
keyInsights: ├── lessons-learned/ # Markdown lessons and insights
- **Advanced analytics** - Machine learning insights
- **Lessons learned** - `@~/.agent-os/lessons-learned/`

sections.title: Agent OS Framework Technology Stack - Agent Improvements
content: # Agent OS Framework Technology Stack - Agent Improvements

sections.title: Overview
content: This document defines the technology stack for improving the .agent-os framework itself. The framework MUST remain simple and portable, using only Markdown (.md) files and JavaScript (.js) files, with focus on Cursor AI integration.

sections.title: Runtime Environment
content: - **Node.js** (≥18.0.0) - JavaScript runtime for all tools and utilities
- **Vanilla JavaScript** - No frameworks or complex dependencies
- **HTML** - Simple dashboards and reports (generated from JavaScript)

sections.title: Development Tools
content: - **File system APIs** - Native Node.js file operations

sections.title: Data Storage
content: - **File-based storage** - JSON files for data persistence

sections.title: Cursor-Specific Tools
content: - **compliance-checker.js** - Main validation engine with Cursor integration
- **statistical-analysis.js** - Analytics and reporting for Cursor usage

sections.title: Cursor Rule Management
content: - **Rule file generation** - Create .mdc files for Cursor rules
- **Rule validation** - Validate Cursor rule syntax and content
- **Rule effectiveness tracking** - Measure how well Cursor rules work

sections.title: Mandatory Simplicity
content: - **No external databases** - Use file system only

sections.title: Portability Requirements
content: - **Single repository** - All code in one place

sections.title: Markdown Standards
content: - **Metadata headers** - YAML front matter for all documents

sections.title: Cursor Rule Standards
content: - **Rule file format** - .md files for Cursor rules (converted to .mdc during init)

sections.title: Cursor AI Integration
content: - **Rule files** - .md files for Cursor rules (converted to .mdc during init)

sections.title: Data Security
content: - **Local storage only** - No external data transmission

sections.title: External Resources
content: **Agent OS Framework Technology Stack** - Simple, portable, and effective tools for standards compliance and Cursor AI integration.
